papers.title: Harnessing data-driven methods for precise model-independent event-shape estimation in relativistic heavy-ion collisions
papers.authors: Dipankar Basak, H Hushnud and Kalyan Dey
papers.source: Journal of Physics G: Nuclear and Particle Physics
papers.summary: This study demonstrates the application of supervised machine learning (ML) techniques to distinguish between isotropic and jet-like event topologies in heavy-ion collisions via the spherocity observable. State-of-the-art ML algorithms, optimized through systematic hyperparameter tuning, are employed to predict both the traditional transverse spherocity S0 and the unweighted transverse spherocity directly from raw event data. Moreover, the results of this study demonstrate that our approach remains largely model-independent, underscoring its potential applicability in future experimental heavy-ion physics analyses.
